intro: Atragene occidentalis, commonly known as the western atragene, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, delicate flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Atragene occidentalis is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with deep root systems that allow it to access moisture from deeper soil layers.
